question.text: Which of the following sequences represent a possible pathway in the production of a secretory protein?

options.text: Rough ER  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Secretory vesicle  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Ribosome  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Golgi apparatus
Ribosome <math><mo>→</mo></math> Rough ER <math><mo>→</mo></math> Golgi apparatus <math><mo>→</mo></math> Secretory vesicle
Secretory vesicle  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Golgi apparatus  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Ribosomes  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Rough ER
Rough ER <math><mo>→</mo></math> Ribosomes <math><mo>→</mo></math> Secretory vesicles <math><mo>→</mo></math> Golgi apparatus

solution.text: Ribosome is the place where protein synthesis takes place  →  rough ER produces proteins and helps them fold properly  →  Golgi bodies does packaging of proteins  →  secretory vesicles does the transport of proteins.
